section.title: Iterate
section.para: The iterate container will execute the embedded actions in loop as long as the defined breaking condition string evaluates to true. The time the condition evaluates to false the iteration will break its processing.

The attribute "indexName" automatically defines a new variable that will always hold the actual loop index. This index variable will be available as normal variable inside the iterate container. Therefore it is possible to print out the actual loop index in the echo action as shown in the above example.
The condition string is mandatory and describes the actual end of the loop. In iterate container the loop will break in case the condition evaluates to false.
The condition string can be any Boolean expression using following operators:

listitem.para: and -> logical combining of two Boolean values
or -> logical combining of two Boolean values

section.para: It is very important to notice that the condition will be evaluated before the execution of the embedded actions take place. The loop therefore can be executed 0-n times according to the condition value.
